titleStmt.title: An antidote against the erroneous, or rather blasphemous, opinions of some people in this our corrupt age; concerning the true and real cause of man's falling into those gross and notorious sins, which do commonly prove his eternal ruine. : Made plain in a short discourse, being the substance of two sermons upon the 12, 14, 15. verses of the 1st chap. of St. James. Let no man say when he is tempted, I am tempted of God, &c. / By Samuel D'Assigny, a well-wisher to the Church of England's prosperity.
titleStmt.author: D'Assigny, Samuel, b. 1673 or 4

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by J.B. and S.P. at the back of Dick's Coffee-House in Skinner-Row,

notesStmt.note: Imperfect: faded and cropped, with loss of print and pagination.
Reproduction of original in: Bodleian Library.

place.placeName: the back of Dick's Coffee-House in Skinner-Row
